notes: SaaS + embedded payments platform for SMBs (education, fitness, field services, personal services). 106K customers, $38B payments. Role is for Momence product line. NOT healthcare. Cover letter must include 'moonshot' and mention 'Mr Pineapple Express'. Apply through their portal, not LinkedIn.

requirements_matched: 10+ years senior engineering leadership — 20+ years, CTO/VP/Director/Chief Architect across 5 companies
Deep technical expertise + business acumen — $2M budget ownership, multi-quarter roadmaps tied to business outcomes, client base growth 12%
Lead globally distributed teams — Managed 50+ developers across US, Ukraine, and Central America (Cognizant)
Defining and executing engineering strategy — Technology roadmaps driving 20% operational efficiency (ilumed), aligned with business needs growing client base (Red Spot)
Strategic hypothesis-driven mindset with bias toward action — Built 3 teams from zero, shipped products in startup environments (Perceptive, Red Spot)
Self-directed leader with thought leadership — CTO-level roles at multiple companies, AI integration pioneer
Experience applying new methodologies — Instituted DevOps/CI/CD improving reliability 35% and deployment frequency 50% (Red Spot), agile transformation increasing velocity 15%
Strong understanding of AWS/cloud-native infrastructure — AWS integrations accelerating deployment 25% (Cognizant), multi-cloud platform AWS/Azure/SaaS (Red Spot)
Microservices architectures and API design — Transformed monolith to microservices/multi-tenant (Cognizant), designed microservices cutting latency 20%
Microservices topologies and operational concerns — Resiliency (99.9% uptime at ilumed), security (HIPAA/SOC2), Kubernetes and CI/CD in technical stack
Bachelor's degree or equivalent — MBA (Shorter) + BS MIS (UAB)
AI/agentic workflow experience (inferred nice-to-have) — AI/ML integration into workflows at 3 companies, AI-driven analytics, NLP experimentation
requirements_partial: Modernizing engineering practices toward AI-enabled delivery models — Strong AI integration experience but in healthcare context, not SaaS delivery model optimization specifically. Has demonstrated AI reducing dev cycles 30% (Perceptive) which is adjacent

Connect & Ecosystem domain (integrations, APIs, partners, platform capabilities) — Extensive API and integration work (HL7, FHIR, EHR integrations, multi-system scheduling platform) but in healthcare ecosystem, not SaaS/payments partner ecosystem

Articulate trade-offs across SaaS/IaaS/PaaS, container orchestration, service mesh, API gateways — Cloud architecture across AWS/Azure/GCP and Kubernetes experience, but service mesh and API gateway experience not specifically documented

Managing architectural debt, governance, evolutionary architecture — Monolith-to-microservices transformation (Cognizant) demonstrates this, but formal governance/architectural debt management frameworks not documented
gaps: SaaS platform and embedded payments domain — Entire career in healthcare IT, no SaaS/payments platform experience
Service mesh experience — Not documented in technical stack
addressable_gaps: SaaS/payments domain — While healthcare-focused, built multi-tenant SaaS-style platforms, API-first architectures, and cloud-native solutions. The engineering patterns transfer; the domain context is learnable
Service mesh — Has Kubernetes, microservices, and API experience. Service mesh is a natural extension of existing infrastructure knowledge
